headline: Greek-Style Potatoes
description: These Greek potatoes are slow-baked in the oven with rosemary, thyme, garlic, olive oil, and lots of fresh lemon juice in this simple potato recipe.
name: Greek-Style Potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Arrange potatoes evenly in the bottom of a medium baking dish.
Mix together water, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, bouillon cubes, thyme, rosemary, and pepper in a small bowl. Pour mixture over potatoes.
Cover and bake in the preheated oven, turning occasionally, until potatoes are tender yet firm, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.

review.reviewBody: Potatoes were unbelievably delicious, my husband said they tasted like ones he had when he was over in Greece! :) Son who is 12, told his Nanny, best potatoes he has ever had; so we are making them again tonight; having them 2X in 72 hours. would recommend adding more potatoes, because left overs & they are absolutely delicious! I didn't have Rosemary available, so I tossed in some chopped Basil & used Yellow Gold potatoes too.

My potatoes got very mushy and I am not sure why? I used baking potatoes. That said, I really liked the flavour of them. I used bottled lemon juice and beef broth because that is what I had and they taste great, but too mushy. I think my oven was too hot at 350F. I wil try again at a lower temperature. The photo shows them after about 30 minutes in the oven.
A little more lemon juice. Fresh lemons are best, but the Realemon works in a pinch. An all around good recipe.

The long cooking time is right, and, yes, you need all the liquid including about 1/4 cup of mustard that is missing from the recipe, which is standard in Greek roasted potatoes. Everyone thinks it’s just lemon, but it’s not. These are supposed to be soft, not crispy, so if you want them to taste like your best local Greek restaurant’s roasted potatoes, follow this recipe and add the mustard. If you don’t like Greek potatoes or lemon, don’t write a review on how you don’t like lemon and changed it into something else; write your own potato recipe that isn’t a Greek dish.

Yes it takes time but if you can get this dish in ahead of what else you are preparing, it’s one less thing to do. I never made a recipe that called for all this liquid but I was curious. I baked for 1.5 hour with foil on but still too much liquid. So I took foil off changed to convection at 375. Sprinkled some Parmesan cheese over top and a few more seasonings and it turned out awesome. Just a little bit of liquid left but the 3 men I served this for loved it. I would make if again for sure. I swapped rosemary for Oregano too. It was flavourful and actually a nice change because the liquid keeps the potatoes moist.

loved it

will use the sauce that was left for pasta.

thnx a million

I have made these potatoes numerous times.. Have to double recipe... do not double liquid I did however add extra lemon juice, garlic and spice to the broth... Taken to party and everyone asked for me to bring again each time.. Easy peasy..Also did not cook for 2 1/2 hours cooked until done..
This is my go to recipe for greek potatoes. Everyone can't get enough of them.
my family loves these and so do I
I didn't have thyme on hand so I subbed in oregano. It was delicious! Will definitely make this again!

Well, to all the naysayers, the recipe states "fresh" lemon juice. If you use concentrated lemon juice, please reconstitute. Those who do not want to follow the directions and cook for the allotted time, the potatoes will never brown. This recipe is awesome AS IS.
I cut the potatoes smaller and cooked for less time. Delicious!
made em as per recipe. perfect. such a great flavor, exactly like the ones I had at a Greek restaurant a few weeks ago.

OMG! Absolutely delicious. Better than my local Greek restaurant and they have great potatoes. Made a few changes to the recipe. The ingredients stayed as is except I cut the water back slightly to 1 1/4 cups, used only 1/5 cup of lemon, replaced the rosemary and thyme with 2 tsp. of Oregano, used 3 chicken bouillon, baked in a casserole dish turning the potatoes 2 times during cooking. This was a huge hit with everyone here.

Will definitely make these again they were amazing! The only thing I did differently was that I didn’t cover it while roasting, they turned out perfect with lightly browned edges. Can’t wait to have theses again
No changes. Came out amazing!!! Thanks
We love this potato dish! Never a drop left each and every time! Excellent.
These are the most amazing potatoes! I would definately serve them to not only our family but guests that come over. Instead of just water I used chicken broth. Delish!

I made these with a roasted chicken
 Great meal, and will make this again. I Just placed potatoes under chicken and roasted. Yummy

I made these with a roasted chicken
 Great meal, and will make this again. I Just placed potatoes under chicken and roasted. Yummy

We both liked this even though I used lime juice instead of lemon as that was all I had on hand, also made about half the recipe for the 2 of us. I used small potatoes, cut in half and used about half of a Knorr boullion cube. Surprisingly good! I would make this again.
Didn't turn out so good to much thyme if I did it next time I might not even add it. ??
Go to recipe. Agreed you don’t need to cook as long as recipe.
These potatoes were fantastic ! Hubby and I enjoyed every bite :)
i made this but I think that 2 cubes chicken is a bit much but other then that this was awesome with make. It again and only use 1 chicken bouillon cube

I made these potatoes, following the recipe, and it was the perfect dish to accompany the souvlaki. Everyone enjoyed them. Despite the cooking time the potatoes weren’t overly crisp, just nicely browned. So good, I’m making them again tonight.
Made it as is and the family unanimously agreed that these were delicious!

Pretty good. I found the liquid amount to be dead on if you cook the potatoes from raw in the oven (greek potatoes usually sit in about a 1/4 inch of liquid when finished cooking). I added 2 extra vegetable bullion cubes and used extra herbs (1 tbsp each fresh rosemary and oregano). I also put them under the broiler for an extra 5 minutes to crisp them up a little at the end. I would reduce the lemon a touch the next time I make them, but, all in all a pretty good recipe.
Like them better crisped up, so added some semolina flour to help with that. Love the overall flavour.
Followed the recipe exactly - turned out great! The family loved it! Next time I will try cutting the potatoes into smaller pieces to get more coverage in terms of flavor.

Excellent as-is. I currently live in Greece, and the actual quality of potatoes here is different/better/buttery. I've made this recipe before I lived here - great. Made it with actual Greece-grown potatoes - excellent.
Didn't like the way this recipe turned out - very lemony

AMAZING, so great with the "Honey Baked Chicken II". Making it tonight. One of my favorite meals to serve. Only thing I add additionally is lemon zest, just because I love lemon flavor and more garlic, just because for me there is never enough garlic.

We loved these potatoes - much better than any we have eaten in a restaurant. I combined the herbs from two recipes -used lots of oregano.and fresh rosemary.
I will definitely makes these again!
Easy to make. My son loved them. Didn't change a thing.
It was delicious but I found the 2 chicken cubes made it very salty. Will try again using 1 cube
I made these with golden potatoes as someone else had suggested and I'm so happy I did. They were absolutely delicious.
I used this potato recipe in this lemon chicken dinner! So good and authentic!
Have made these many times. Love it and the kids gobbled them up.
Great fries but tastes like something was missing? When I tried it at a Greek festival, the fries were a little more tangy. Will do again with some additional ingredients next time...
My family loves this dish! I use Yukon Gold or Red potatoes. The cook quicker, and get nice and mushy on this inside while they get nice and crispy on the outside.
I boiled some potatoes and chicken broth with garlic first before baking them. I used fresh herbs. I followed some of the advice from the other reviewer's.
Delicious. Super simple to make and flavor to suit all who are dining.
Excellent! They taste very similar to potatoes I've had at a Greek restaurant near my house. I cooked mine for just over an hour and a half, and they turned out really well.

I made these with red potatoes and used about 8 all together. I also wrapped these in tin foil as made by one reviewer. They had a good taste but there was way to much oil and lemon juice for the amount of potatoes I used. Not sure if it was the lack of potatoes or that the recipe could have been cut down on both ingredients. I won't be making them because we have other potatoes that we like better. .
Very good. I added an extra bouillon cube and extra garlic. I added a touch of salt as well. For the last 30 min I cranked the oven to 450 to brown the potatoes a bit.

These turned out great. I used oregano instead of the other herbs for personal preference. I let the potatoes soak in the mixture a few hours prior to cooking. I started them off in the microwave to reduce the cooking time. I served them with chicken souvlaki brochettes and tzatziki sauce.

Made as written except for cooking time. Whole baked potatoes take less time than recipe states for these sliced potatoes. It was bland and not something I will make again. I make a similar recipe roasting the potatoes with sea salt, pepper, less oil and no water, adding lemon zest. Plus adding garlic and fresh herbs instead of dried.

Halved the water, and turned out pretty good. I added cayenne pepper and used fresh rosemary, otherwise followed directions. Can't give it five stars because it would be pretty mushy with that much water.

GOOD FAST EASY. We enjoyed these. A simple recipe , but makes quite different potatoes for a change. I liked the lemon but might try with a little less next time. I did cook for full amount of time and they were fine but I don't think I had to. I think these can be drained and refrigerate to serve warmed later.
Easy pre made for company. Definitely make again.

Delicious pototo recipe! Greek style potatoes are one of my favourites and discovering the simplicity of acheiving that flavour is an excellent addition to my "go to" dishes! The modifications that I applied to this recipe are that I first melt butter and add this to the potatoes in the roaster pan along with salt & pepper. After tossing and coating the potatoes with the butter, I then pour over the mixture. It is best to always use fresh squeezed lemon juice when making the mixture! Rather than the individual herbs listed, I use fresh dill and a Greek herb mix from Epicure. I have made this a few times with different potatoes and it always turns out wonderful regardless of which type chosen.

I tweaked the recipe slightly. used chicken broth (premade) instead of the water and beef cubes.

cooked at 425 uncovered for 1 hour. came out great.

The recipe doesn't state what type of thyme, I am assuming it is leaves because I used ground thyme and the flavor was too intense. I did add 1 tsp. of oregano as well. Overall, a good dish but would definitely reduce the lemon juice to half of what is called for, it was way to overpowering. As noted in previous reviews, I decreased the water by 1/4 cup, only used 1/4 cup oil, and increased the baking temperature to 400F. Will make again, but just tweak it a bit more.
Nice lemon flavor . Simply delicious!

Delicious pototo recipe! Greek style potatoes are one of my favourites and discovering the simplicity of acheiving that flavour is an excellent addition to my "go to" dishes! The modifications that I applied to this recipe are that I first melt butter and add this to the potatoes in the roaster pan along with salt & pepper. After tossing and coating the potatoes with the butter, I then pour over the mixture. It is best to always use fresh squeezed lemon juice when making the mixture! Rather than the individual herbs listed, I use fresh dill and a Greek herb mix from Epicure. I have made this a few times with different potatoes and it always turns out wonderful regardless of which type chosen.
This was great... my family said "it tastes like authentic Greek restaurant potatoes". Loved the lemony flavour. I used greek seasoning in place of the suggested spices, everything else the same.

I used half sweet potato, DELISH! These were so flavourful! I used chicken broth in place of the water and cubes. Replaced rosemary with oregano (taste preference). Also added the zest of the entire lemon, and instead of slicing the garlic smashed them and left them whole so I could eat those(used 4). Mine baked in 1 hour at 375. The juices were so delectable. I really would suggest cooking them low and slow. I've looked at a few other recipes for Greek potatoes.. But most don't say to cover.. I feel that covering them allows the moisture to soak into the potatoes more.. Also makes them so tender.. And really like the ones you get at your favourite Greek restaurant. I cut my potatoes in half (medium sized) and my sweet potatoes in fairly large chunks and they cooked up just fine. I suggest only using a drizzle of olive oil.. As I believe 1/3 is a tad much. This will become a staple in my house now.. Thanks!

I made one small change. I boiled the potatoes for about 15 minutes and then tossed in the olive oil sauce (minus the water) and put it to bake. I like them a little crispy. It was wonderful and the boiling helped the potatoes to absorb the flvor of the sauce. It was amazing.

I think the length of cooking time is essential to capturing the texture that makes these truly greek style potatoes. It's a very particular texture you never knew you needed in your life until you've had it or lost it. Since most greek yiayias dont write down their recipes, it can be tough figuring out h ow to make dishes from childhood. These seem pretty close. Every family is different, of course, but these capture the main idea.

Absolutely delicious potato dish. Have shared recipe with many people who love it as well. I always double the recipe so their are leftovers, especially grilled potatoes for breakfast. Awesome!!!! I always use straight chicken broth for water and cubes. Sometimes I substitute wine for the lemon juice and use Herb de Provence for spices.
This turned out great! I followed the recipe as is. Thank you!
PERFECT!!! I boiled the potatoes first to cut down on baking time and they turned out delish!!

Made these exactly as directed (always do to start with) these were amazing! Better than even the restaurant ones we love! Kids loved them, hubby loved them, and it makes a nice big batch (good thing they were devoured) Trust me try these as is you won't be disappointed! Thank you for sharing this great recipe!!!

We really enjoyed this. I cooked them covered for an hr at 400 degrees and took the cover off for the last 15 mins. I also cut them into smaller bit size cubes. Only used 1/4 cup oil and 1 cup water to dissolve the boullion. Also added oregano. I used white potatoes. Yukon potatoes would be just as good.
I would use chichen broth instead of water.Taste better, you can use a little bit of water but not a cup and a half.Takes the taste away.
I use much less olive oil and it still taste great, i used 1//8 of a cup of olive oil.
Absolutely delicious. I followed the recipe to a tee and the potatoes turned out perfect.
Better than at any restaurant! I love Greek style potatoes and I followed the recipe exactly. My family and I had to stop ourselves from eating these. They are THAT good. This is a keeper for sure.

Next time I would add a little less lemon, but they were still very delicious and I wouldn't blame the recipe, was probably my error in adding too much. Try this recipe if you like greek potatoes, as it is spot on.

Excellent! But go real easy on the liquid. I cut the water, olive oil, and lemon juice in half, and it was just perfect. More would have had the potatoes swimming. We're not rosemary fans so I used oregano and a dash each of basil and thyme. I also added a shake of sea salt. This went beautifully with over roasted chicken, and the whole family liked it.

Love this recipe! made it 3 times already and its better than any other greek potatoes that you can buy at a restaurant! Only addition I made to the recipe was par-boiling the potatoes and only cooking them for an hour as I wanted to reduce the cooking time and I feel like they absorb the flavour more. I added some oregano in as well. Other than those slight changes everything else was the same. This comes HIGHLY RECOMMENDED its fool proof! it takes so little time to make and the flavour cannot be beat! everyone who tries these LOVES them!
Very yummy. Would use less water and more garlic next time.
Love these! they are great the next day roasted in the oven without the liquid

I made these as is except I added oregano as well. They weren't bad, but they definitely were not nearly as good as any Greek restaurant that I've been to. They weren't as flavorful And I don't like the idea of cooking them covered. I did it, but I uncovered them during cooking because they were starting to steam, and I wanted them more roasted. I'll be looking for a different greek potato recipe.
OMG!!
Loved the lemony taste and spices. Water turned into small amount of thickened sauce in bottom ov pan . Yum !

These are the best potatoes I have ever eaten in my life. I used chicken broth instead of the bouillon and water, and dill in place of the thyme. I could not stop eating them and ate them for breakfast the next day. I will make these potatoes forever!
These were so delicious. I took off the foil for the last half hour to crisp up the top of the potatoes. They tasted just like ones I've had on holiday in Greece. Gorgeous!

ABSOLUTELY PERFECT! These were the best potatoes I ever had! Even better then in the restaurant. I used aluminum foil to cover the potatoes and turned the oven on maximum. The potatoes were ready after 1 h 15 min -- enough time to prepare a broccoli salad and Greek bifteki. Yummmmm

These were absolutely amazing. I followed the recipe "as is" except I cooked them uncovered. That solved the potential "soupyness" issue. I also added a pinch of oregano. Served with chicken and a salad. These are our new staple potato recipe.
This is now one of our family favorites
I've been looking for a great lemon potatoes recipe for years and now I've found it these are perfect!
Fantastic! So easy to just put together quickly and throw in the oven. Great flavor - everyone took seconds!

These were really good. Used stock and added more oregano. Kept olive oil and lemon. Served with my tatzikki and marinara pork. Would make again. Would do be great to serve for a big crowd with all Greek food.

I would make these potatoes again, but they are a little bland as written. Like other reviewers I omitted the water and just used enough broth to partially cover the potatoes. Next time I'll increase the spices a bit and add some salt.

I followed DONNA1000 tips, and these turned out perfect!
Thanks!

Rather than chicken bullion and water I used chicken stock (and less of it). I think the key to locking in the flavour is basting the potatoes pretty frequently as you go along. I think you get a significantly better texture if you don't boil the potatoes, and you could use oregano with or instead of rosemary. It's so worth it to cook them, and baste them the full time.
These are fantastic - really restaurant quality. A huge hit every time I make them!

Very good recipe, but I changed it a bit as per another Greek recipe on this site. I basically combined the 2. I scaled this down for 2-3 people. I had no lemon, used fresh rosemary and italian seasoning. I cooked it at 400F for 1 hour covered and 15 minutes uncovered. Then I added crumbled feta and cooked for 5 more minutes, finishing with a broil. YUM. I picked this recipe over the other because of your use of the chicken bouillon - really adds flavour. Great basis and next time will add onions!

I just made this tonight and I followed Donna's instruction (below) but a little different. I used 6 Yukon gold potatoes, and I boiled them (quartered) with one chicken boullion cube and one clove of garlic cut in half. I boiled them until almost done and then transferred the potatoes to a baking dish (9x13). As for the marinade I used JUST 1/3 cup olive oil, microwaved my lemon for 25 seconds (also made a cut in the skin- it came out pretty hot in one spot, be careful) and then zested as much of it as I could and then cut it in half, removed the seeds and squeezed out all of the juice. I decided it needed more lemon juice so I added some from a bottle (about a tablespoon). Then I used 1tsp ground thyme, 1tsp dried rosemary and half a crushed chicken boullion cube and finally, ground pepper and pink salt to taste. I stirred it good then poured it over my potatoes and stirred them up to coat them. I baked them uncovered for 15mins at 350 then stirred them and then put them back in for another 15mins, until the outsides get a bit crispy :) My fiancé loved them! He says he doesn't care what real Greek potatoes taste like because apparently my version was awesome. Enjoy :)

Delicious! I made some changes - par boiled the potatoes (having cut in to 6 not 4)for about 4 mins and only used 3/4 cup of water. I also added zest of a lemon as previously suggested. After 90 mins, and turning twice they were perfect.

This was so great! I love love love the taste of these potatoes and will be making them very frequently! I did add more garlic and lemon and they were very great.
Thank you!

Definitely could have cut down on the water, but other than that this was a pretty good recipe. I had to triple it, as I was having quite a few guests over, and it took just over 2 hours to cook. That was fine with me, as we had appetizers in the meantime, but I can see that amount of time being an issue on other occasions.
The potatoes weren't very lemon-y, actually. I found the rosemary stronger than anything. Some guests mentioned they preferred that, as they didn't like too much lemon flavouring on potatoes. But to be honest I would have preferred a more strong lemon taste. Probably just a personal preference.
Taking one star off for the amount of time it takes and the crazy amount of water.
Delicious. Very simple, the hardest part is waiting for them to cook. :)
Just like at a Greek restaurant! :) My tummy was happy after eating this. If you prefer your potatoes to be less dry though, I'd recommend adding more liquids.

So good! I too boiled my potato wedges in some vegetable/lemon broth before putting them into the oven to bake. I kept the lemon juice in the dressing and it turned out AMAZING! Crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.

Very nice. Ate at a Greek restaurant last night and loved their roast potatoes, went looking for a recipe and found this one. The only change I made was to cook the potatoes at 450 for 50 minutes instead of 350 for 2 hours, and I turned them once at about 20 minutes. Came out delicious.
Great recipe,will make again an added with sprinkle of parm cheese on top!!

These were really yummy. I didn't have 2+ hours though, so I boiled in broth with garlic and then tossed in a lot of lemon juice, Greek seasoning, oregano, salt and pepper, thyme and rosemary. Baked at 350 for about 30 minutes, turning once! Delish! Hubby loved them, will try the original way next time when I have more time! Thanks! :)
